header.title: ESOTERIC EXTENSION OF TAROT TO DEVELOP SUPERSENSORY POWERS LESSON 28

central_thesis: Tarot Key 9, The Hermit, interpreted through Qabalistic, numerical, astrological, and sensory attributions, especially the foundational role of the sense of touch, serves as a profound tool for developing supersensory powers, realizing the interconnectedness of all existence, and achieving conscious union with the Divine.

structure_content.summary: This lesson introduces Key 9, The Hermit, as a representation of a 'finished product' and a 'fulfillment of experience' within a cyclic development originating from The Fool. The Hermit embodies achieved wisdom, guiding others with the light of the Higher Self.

The text delves into the Qabalistic interpretations of Key 9, emphasizing its assignment to the Hebrew letter Yod. It explains the dual numerical significance of Hebrew letters (e.g., Aleph=1, assigned to Key 0) as a potent meditative technique to awaken 'fourth dimensional experiences'.

Yod, as the first letter of the divine name Yod-Heh-Vav-Heh (Jehovah), is presented as crucial for understanding vibrational powers. The lesson highlights Yod's shape as a flame and its symbolism as the 'ultimate particle' or 'fundamental building block' (Yekhidah), representing the Indivisible One and our shared identity with the All.

structure_content.chapter_title: Yod, Will, and the Sense of Touch
structure_content.summary: Yod is associated with 'Intelligence of Will' and the astrological sign Virgo. The lesson uniquely attributes Yod and Key 9 to the sense of touch, linking it to the union of opposites, receptivity, and 'clairsentience'. It posits that Qabalistic interpretations intricately connect the letter, number, and sensory experience.

A core tenet is that the sense of touch is the 'truest esoteric understanding' and the foundational basis for all other senses (sight, hearing, taste, smell). All perception is described as a form of touching, emphasizing consciousness as the ultimate perceiver acting through this fundamental sense, tracing its evolution from living protoplasm to complex sensory organs.

structure_content.chapter_title: Developing the Sense of Touch for Spiritual Growth
structure_content.summary: The text prescribes a practice of consciously engaging the sense of touch to deepen spiritual understanding. By realizing that 'everything we touch can be nothing but an aspect of God,' practitioners can heighten their perceptions, experience 'rapturous unity' with the Higher Self, and store these insights via the High Priestess (subconsciousness) for ultimate remembrance of their 'True and One Identity'.

The lesson concludes with specific exercises for the advanced student, encouraging deliberate awareness of the texture and feel of objects, nature, and living beings. This disciplined sensory engagement, guided by the Hermit's light, aims to balance inner psychic development with outer sensory experience, leading to greater discernment and spiritual progress.

key_concepts.definition: A Tarot key representing the culmination and fulfillment of experience, a 'finished product' of cyclic development from The Fool, embodying guiding wisdom and the light of the Higher Self.

The Hebrew letter assigned to Tarot Key 9; shaped like a flame, it symbolizes the 'ultimate particle,' 'fundamental building block,' and means 'that which is, that which was, and that which will be.' It is linked to the Hand of God, Intelligence of Will, and the sense of touch.

The fundamental, primary sense from which all other senses (sight, hearing, taste, smell) are elaborations or specialized developments. Esoterically, it is the means by which consciousness perceives and interacts with reality, crucial for spiritual development and recognizing divinity in all things.
A Qabalistic concept, symbolized by Yod and Key 9, meaning 'the Indivisible One,' representing the ultimate, singular identity shared by all beings and the fundamental unity of existence.
A type of consciousness associated with the Hebrew letter Yod, representing will power as an active principle, distinct from the principle of will itself (Key 7).

Higher states of consciousness and perception, beyond the ordinary three dimensions, awakened through specific meditation techniques involving the correlation of symbolic associations like Hebrew letters and Tarot numbers.

A Tarot key representing the substance of subconsciousness and the basis of universal memory. Its principle is indicated to express itself through the activity of The Hermit, aiding in storing heightened perceptions for spiritual remembrance.

practical_system.description: The practical system outlined is a method of conscious sensory engagement, primarily focusing on the sense of touch, to develop supersensory perception and realize the inherent divinity in all things. It involves training the mind to recognize the interconnectedness of all physical interactions with the divine source, thereby elevating everyday experiences into opportunities for mystical insight and union.
tools: Tarot Key 9 (The Hermit) for meditation and understanding its symbolic guidance.
Tarot Key 2 (The High Priestess) for understanding subconsciousness and memory as storage for heightened perceptions.
The Hebrew letter Yod and its associated Qabalistic meanings (e.g., 'Intelligence of Will', 'Indivisible One') for focused contemplation.
rituals: Direct consciousness to the sense of touch during daily activities.
Become aware of subtle differences in the feel and texture of all articles handled.
Engage with nature consciously, e.g., feeling the breeze on the face, walking barefoot in grass.
Practice touching objects (e.g., a glass, a flower, a pet) with the explicit realization that one is touching an 'aspect of God' and a 'miracle of consciousness'.

relevant_quotes.text: The Hermit wears a blue cap, shaped like the letter Yod. The pure blue color of the cap is one of many indications that the principle of the High Priestess expresses itself in and through this activity.

This double assignment of numbers should not confuse you. There are two distinct lines of interpretation and when they mesh they give the mind definite associations, which can lead to a potent form of meditation that awakens fourth dimensional experiences.
This letter, Yod, is the first holy letter of the divine name, which means 'that which is, that which was, and that which will be.'
The very shape of this letter is meant to tell subconsciousness one thing, and its assignment to the first place in the divine name is meant to tell another thing.
The truest esoteric understanding depends on knowing what the sense of touch is. The meaning of this letter itself is 'hand,' the open hand, the hand of God, which shapes all things.
Our senses are but elaborations, specialized developments of the sense of touch.
When we touch anything, we must train ourselves to remember that we are touching some aspect of God.

critical_analysis.relevance: This lesson offers a distinctive Hermetic and Qabalistic framework for understanding sensory perception, elevating the sense of touch from a mundane physiological function to a primary spiritual interface. Its unique reinterpretation of sensory experience, linking it directly to divine perception and higher consciousness, makes it highly relevant for occult practitioners seeking an embodied approach to mystical realization and the development of supersensory faculties. It bridges theoretical esoteric principles with practical, daily awareness, providing a tangible path for spiritual growth.
critical_analysis.target_audience: The target audience consists of advanced students and practitioners of Western Esotericism, particularly those with a foundational understanding of Tarot and Qabalistic principles. The text assumes familiarity with these systems and aims to deepen their application for developing 'supersensory powers' and achieving a 'consciousness of union with the All'. It is suitable for individuals committed to disciplined self-observation and esoteric practice.
